clinicalDescription: Overview: A feeling of fear or apprehension about what's to come that are strong enough to interfere with daily activities. Examples of anxiety disorders include panic attacks, obsessive-compulsive disorder, and post-traumatic stress disorder.Presentation: Stress that's out of proportion to the impact of the event, inability to set aside a worry, and restlessness. increased heart rate, fast breathing, and trouble concentrating or sleeping Assessment: Diagnosis requires a lengthy process of physical examinations, mental health evaluations, and psychological questionnairesPlan: Psychotherapy and medication (antidepressants and sedatives), lifestyle changes Prognosis: Anxiety may not go away, but can be managed and live a healthy, happy life
